attributes.action: To stop free TV licence for MPs and continue free TV licence for over 75s
attributes.additional_details: I have read it online. I wasn’t aware of this, when I accidentally saw that on line. And it was on channel 4 news.
attributes.background: This is very unfair for politicians to have free TV licence when they can afford to pay,  whilst people over 75 who paid their taxes all their lives. Don’t destroy their happiness.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/ 

The House of Commons recently debated a petition to retain free TV licences for the over-75s. You can watch or read the debate here:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/234627
